attributes.action: Protect the Oak trees in Craythorne Road, Stretton, Burton-on-Trent
attributes.additional_details:
Protect the old Oak trees (aproxamate age 70yrs) and hedgerows lining Craythorne Road, Stretton, Burton-on-Trent with a TPO (tree preservation order) These trees are being threatened by development and possible road widening to facilitate a development of 385 houses.
The trees and hedgerow are a very important part of the village and a heaven for wildlife.
attributes.background: Protect the old Oak trees (aproxamate age 70yrs) and hedgerows lining Craythorne Road, Stretton, Burton-upon-Trent with a TPO (tree preservation order) These trees are being threatened by development and possible road widening to facilitate the development.

rejection.details:
This is a matter for the local authority, which appears to be East Staffordshire Borough Council, not the UK Government or Parliament. It would be for East Staffs Council to issue a TPO: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/tree-preservation-orders-and-trees-in-conservation-areas.

You could start a petition on this issue on the Council's e-petition system here: http://www.eaststaffsbc.gov.uk/council-democracy/e-petitions.
